Hearthstone Challenges

  • 1 Every card must contain at least one character with a beard.
  • 2 There must be at least one female character visible in every card.
  • 3 You must play a card every turn. First one to fail or die loses.
  • 4 Random damage only: No direct damage to the enemy hero. Minions may trade, and the hero power can be used on minions.
  • 5 No humanoids can be visible in your cards.
  • 6 Play as Mage. If you have two mana or more, you must Fireblast your own face.
  • 7 Any class, but cards can not cost more than 1 mana. Go to 2 mana if you run out.
  • 8 You cannot target the enemy hero unless you have lethal.
  • 9 Both players have to pass until turn five.
  • 10 You make the deck for your opponent. You can be as mean as you want.
  • 11 You pick 10 cards for your opponent.
  • 12 Make a deck. Your opponent can remove four cards and add something else in their place.
  • 13 No two-mana cards allowed.
  • 14 No four-mana cards allowed.
  • 15 No deathrattles allowed.
  • 16 No battlecries allowed.
  • 17 Roll two new challenges, and combine them. If the combination is impossible, roll two more.
  • 18 No deathrattles and no battlecries allowed.
  • 19 Each deck must cost exactly 100 mana.
  • 20 You can not overkill the enemy hero or enemy minions.
  • 21 No class cards allowed.
  • 22 Select three classes each. Your opponent may ban one card from being used by each class before you make your deck.
  • 23 If you can play the card you just drew, you must play it.
  • 24 Fill your deck based on cards suggested by the innkeeper.
  • 25 Common cards only.
  • 26 No classic cards.
  • 27 Build a deck with Ogres and Troggs. I'd recommend running a silence or two.
  • 28 You can not play more than one card per turn.
  • 29 You win when you put the enemy hero to 1 HP. Killing the enemy hero on your turn counts as a loss.
  • 30 You can only run a single copy of each card.
  • 31 You pick 15 cards for your opponent.
  • 32 Play with the default decks. Any class.
  • 33 First one to kill their own hero wins.
  • 34 Your cards must cost four or more.
  • 35 Only even cost cards: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 20.
  • 36 Only odd cost cards: 1, 3, 5, 7, 9.
  • 37 No hero power.
  • 38 Build a deck with a specific tribe: Murlocs, Demons, Mechs, Pirates etc.
  • 39 Build a deck with cards you have, but never use. Play with your least played hero.
  • 40 When you run out of cards, you win.
  • 41 No cards from the latest two Hearthstone solo adventures allowed.
  • 42 Prepare three different decks. Losing decks get knocked out, and the winner is the last player standing.
  • 43 Prepare three different decks. Losing decks get knocked out, and the winner is the last player standing. The loser has to disenchant a card.
  • 44 Let the innkeeper suggest cards, but your opponent chooses which one. May require Skype or similar.
  • 45 Humanoids only. Be as strict as you want.
  • 46 30 minutes to construct 3 decks across different classes. Minions can only have odd attack values, and spells can only have even mana costs.
  • 47 Deathrattle deck. Any class.
  • 48 You must spend all your mana every turn. If you fail to do so, pass the next turn.
  • 49 You can not overkill minions.
  • 50 Skip the first three turns.
  • 51 The first player to take fatigue damage wins.
  • 52 If you can play the leftmost card in your hand, you must play it.
  • 53 Mage, Paladin or Hunter. Secret deck.
  • 54 All cards must have a random effect.
  • 55 You both have to play the same deck. Build the deck together.
  • 56 You both play Hunter, but you can't use your hero power.
  • 57 First one to kill their own hero wins. Majordomo Executus is banned.
  • 58 You both play Hunter. No minions allowed.
  • 59 You both play a mill deck.
  • 60 Pick a card for you opponent. You have to make a deck based around that card.
  • 61 Find your worst Legendary card. Make a deck based around that card.
  • 62 Put as many taunt creatures as possible in your deck. Minions or buffs providing taunt permitted.
  • 63 Make your deck as mana expensive as possible. Start with your most expensive card, and add more in decreasing order. Class cards are permitted if you get to that cost.
  • 64 Build a deck from the original Hearthstone cards, before Naxxramas was introduced.
  • 65 Big Game Hunter is banned. Any class.
  • 66 You can not spend all your mana.
  • 67 Any deck. Any class. No Ragnaroses allowed.
  • 68 No spells or weapons.
  • 69 Your minions must have more attack than health. Any class.
  • 70 Your minions must have more health than attack. Any class.
  • 71 You must both skip turn 3, 5, and 7.
  • 72 Build a deck and announce your class. Your opponent may ban any two cards from being used in the following match, and you can not replace them (if you have them).
  • 73 Build two decks together. Make sure you have the cards to play them, and flip a coin to decide the player of each deck.
  • 74 Pick 10 cards for your deck. The inkeeper will fill the rest.
  • 75 You must kill the enemy hero with your own hero. I'd recommend a weapon class.
  • 76 15 seconds per turn. May require an additional player as a judge.
  • 77 Team up and do a complete arena run together.
  • 78 Build your decks around Windfury combos.
  • 79 You may only run two copies of 5 different cards. The remaining 20 cards must be unique.
  • 80 No minions allowed. Minions from spells are permitted.
  • 81 You have to use your hero power every turn from turn two.
  • 82 Both play Priest. If you have two mana or more, you must heal the enemy hero.
  • 83 Muligan for Lorewalker Cho, and play a full match with the card in play. You may not kill, silence or taunt Cho. Healing and health buffs are permitted.
  • 84 Every card must have a hat or other head accessory.
  • 85 Any deck. Any class. You can only use the top 15 cards you draw.
  • 86 Buy a pack each, and build a deck with your new cards. If you open several different class cards, use a similar card for the hero you chose.
  • 87 Your opponent must die to Elven Archer. Any class.
  • 88 End the game on your opponent's turn. You lose if it ends on your turn, unless it's a draw.
  • 89 Build a popular deck, but find a rough replacement for every card.
  • 90 Pick your most played deck, and make a new deck with the same hero. You can not use any cards from the previous deck.
